text: The 1938 Western Reserve Red Cats football team represented Western Reserve University in the American city of Cleveland, Ohio, now known as Case Western Reserve University, during the 1938 college football season. The team was coached by college football hall of fame coach Bill Edwards. Notable players included Johnny Wilson, Mike Rodak, Steve Belichick, and Dick Booth. The team went undefeated defeating opponents by a combined 259-31. ==Schedule== ==References== Western Reserve Category:Case Western Reserve Spartans football seasons Category:College football undefeated seasons Western Reserve football
title: 1938 Western Reserve Red Cats football team
